alert.note: Alert for Bell; Falls; Milam; Robertson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 18 at 8:35AM CST by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 AM CST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of Central Texas, including the following areas, Bell, Falls, Milam and Robertson. * WHEN...Until 1030 AM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor-drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will likely cause small stream flooding. Low lying and/or poor drainage areas will experience minor flooding in the advisory area. Rain gauges across eastern Bell County have observed between 1 and 3 inches of rain in the past three hours. Up to 1 inch of additional rain will be possible through mid-morning. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Rockdale, Cameron, Hearne, Little River-Academy, Rosebud, Thorndale, Rogers, Calvert, Holland, Bremond, Lott, Buckholts and Milano.
info.instruction: In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
